title: Type of Design: Neighborhood Watch
question_text: Neighborhood watch is a program designed where a group of civilians are devoted to prevent  crime and vandalism in a neighborhood.  A research group, known as the Watchmen want to know if the neighborhood watch is actually effective. The Watchmen locate $20$ pairs of neighborhoods, where each pair is similar in size, economic status,  number of streetlights, number of dogs, number of nosy neighbors, etc. One neighborhood in each pair is randomly assigned to have  the neighborhood watch program and the other does not. This is an example of

choices.text: A randomized block design, but not matched pairs.
